item.title: Need help as soon as possible!
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“demoniczerk, post:4, topic:464462”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=568456.msg4127020#msg4127020 date=1350577660]
Add “-cp .;” without the quotations before you name the class.
[/quote]

It worked, I love you man.[/quote]

You’re welcome lol.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help as soon as possible!

item.title: Need help as soon as possible!
item.dc:creator: @demoniczerk demoniczerk
item.description:
@demoniczerk wrote:

Hello, I have been having this problem and I have been googling this for days.
I have tried uninstalling the latest JDK and installing previous versions and all that shtuff.
I also have all of the necessary files to load the client in the correct directory.
This problem only occurs when I attempt to run a client, when I run a server it works perfectly. I first thought it was a problem with loading Gui’s but I am able to play official Runescape just fine.

I have tried all of these:

@echo off
title Client
cd class
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javaw.exe” -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

@echo off
title Client
cd class
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

@echo off
title Client
cd class
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

@echo off
title Client
cd class
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_29\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

All of these are correct paths, i’m not a moron…
This is the error that each of them return:
Error: Could not find or load main class client
Press any key to continue . . . <— Not an error. >_>

Help would greatly be appreciated as I have been trying to figure this out for some time now.
Thank you in advance.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help as soon as possible!
